title: 104_s2018
content: The Act titled "Oroville-Tonasket Claim Settlement and Conveyance Act" authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to implement a negotiated Settlement Agreement for the conveyance of Project Irrigation Works to the District. The Act defines key terms such as "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "Reclamation" as the United States Bureau of Reclamation, "District" as the Oroville-Tonasket Irrigation District, and "Project" as the Oroville-Tonasket unit extension in Washington. The Act defines key terms such as "Secretary" as the Secretary of the Interior, "Reclamation" as the United States Bureau of Reclamation, "District" as the Oroville-Tonasket Irrigation District, and "Project" as the Oroville-Tonasket unit extension in Washington. The term "Project Irrigation Works" refers to existing works described in the Repayment Contract, including equipment and third party agreements. The term "Basic Contract" means the Repayment Contract. The term "Basic Contract" refers to Repayment Contract No. 14-06-100-4442, dated December 26, 1964, between the United States and the District. The term "Repayment Contract" refers to Repayment Contract No. 0-07-10-W0242, dated November 28, 1979, between the United States and the District. The term "third party agreements" refer to existing contractual duties related to Project Irrigation Works, excluding power arrangements with the Bonneville Power Administration. The term "Wildlife Mitigation Facilities" includes land, improvements, or easements. The term "Indian Trust Lands" refers to approximately 61 acres of lands owned by the Colville Tribes or individual Indians, held in trust by the United States. The term "Settlement Agreement" refers to a specific agreement. The "Settlement Agreement" refers to the agreement made on April 15, 1996, between the United States and the Oroville-Tonasket Irrigation District. "O&M" refers to normal care, control, operation, repair, replacement, and maintenance. The Settlement Agreement approved by SEC. 4 authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to conduct necessary investigations and actions. SEC. 5 addresses consideration and satisfaction of outstanding obligations. Consideration by the District to the United States under the Settlement Agreement includes a payment of $350,000, assuming full liability for irrigation facilities, and taking responsibility for the O&M of the Project Irrigation Works. The District assumes full liability for irrigation facilities and takes responsibility for the O&M of the Project Irrigation Works, releasing the United States from past and future claims related to the Project. The District also indemnifies and defends the United States against third party claims, except for specific exceptions, and continues its obligation to deliver water. The District is responsible for O&M of the Project Irrigation Works and indemnifies the United States against third party claims. In return, the United States releases the District from certain obligations, transfers title of the Project Irrigation Works, and continues power deliveries. The District indemnifies the United States against claims such as the Grillo Claim and government contractor construction claims, as well as any other suits filed against the United States as of the Settlement Agreement date. SEC. 6. POWER. The United States will provide power for irrigation water pumping, with limits on amount and duration. SEC. 7. CONVEYANCE. The Secretary is authorized to convey all Project Irrigation Works to the District, retaining title to Wildlife Mitigation Facilities. The United States reserves oil, gas, and mineral rights and perpetual public access. The Secretary can convey Project Irrigation Works to the District, while retaining title to Wildlife Mitigation Facilities. The United States reserves mineral rights and perpetual public access for fishing, hunting, and outdoor recreation. Upon conveyance of title to the Project Irrigation Works, the 1964 Basic Contract and the 1979 Repayment Contract between the District and Reclamation will be terminated. The District remains obligated to deliver water to Indian Trust Lands under water service contracts. Upon conveyance of Project Irrigation Works, the District assumes liability for all operation and use, absolving the United States of responsibility for design and construction. The District also indemnifies and defends the United States against all claims related to the Project. The District assumes liability for all operation and use of Project Irrigation Works, indemnifying and defending the United States against claims related to the Project, except for specific government contractor construction claims and suits filed as of the Settlement Agreement date. SEC. 11. CERTAIN ACTS NOT APPLICABLE AND TERMINATION OF MANDATES. The Reclamation Laws mandates on Project Irrigation Works will end upon completion of transfers as per the Settlement Agreement. Future Reclamation benefits will require Congress approval. The transfer of title is not subject to the Administrative Procedures Act or considered disposal of surplus property. The transfer of title is not subject to the Administrative Procedures Act or considered disposal of surplus property under specific federal acts.
